p: Anise is a food plant for the larvae of some Lepidoptera species such as butterflies and moths. Anise was first cultivated in Egypt and the Middle East and was brought to Europe for its medicinal value [ 41]. Anise EO can be obtained from the fruits by the steam distillation technique. The main component of anise EO is anethole (80â€“90%), with minor components including 4-anisaldehyde, estragole, and pseudoisoeugenyl-2-methylbutyrates [ 42].
